title: Did you follow the local news this week? Take our Greater Boston news quiz.
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Boston.com releases a news quiz to test knowledge on trending Greater Boston stories.
Peter Chianca has been Boston.com's general assignment editor since 2019.
The quiz highlights recent events and popular stories in the Greater Boston area.

title: MBTA Hingham ferry service canceled for Feb. 13 due to ice in the harbor
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: MBTA cancels Hingham/Hull ferry service for February 13 due to ice in Boston Harbor.
Shuttle buses will replace ferry service, running from Nantasket Beach to Hull Ferry Terminal.
Recent winter storm caused thick ice, leading to multiple ferry cancellations this season.

title: Retired Gloucester firefighter dies days after being struck by Lowell police cruiser
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Retired Gloucester firefighter Daniel Kennedy died after being struck by a Lowell police cruiser at UMass Lowell.
The incident occurred on February 5; Kennedy was walking on Wilder Street when hit by the police vehicle.
An investigation by the Middlesex DA's Office and Massachusetts State Police is ongoing following Kennedy's death.

title: 5 players on Red Sox’ roster bubble entering spring training
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Triston Casas may start 2026 season in Triple-A Worcester due to health concerns and the emergence of Willson Contreras at first base.
Kristian Campbell likely to open season in Worcester after struggling both offensively and defensively in 2025 with the Red Sox.
Pitching prospects Payton Tolle and Connelly Early may begin 2026 in minors due to a crowded Red Sox starting rotation.

title: Plans confirmed for new ICE facility in N.H.; documents reveal state officials knew for weeks
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Plans for a new ICE facility in Merrimack, New Hampshire, were known by state officials as early as January 12.
Documents released by the ACLU reveal state officials were aware of plans that sparked controversy within Gov. Kelly Ayotte's administration.
The proposed facility is expected to cost $158 million to renovate and $146 million to operate over three years.

title: Ex-Patriots coach Dante Scarnecchia isn’t panicking over Will Campbell’s play
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Will Campbell remains at left tackle for the Patriots despite poor end to 2025 season, according to Mike Vrabel.
Former coach Dante Scarnecchia supports keeping Campbell at left tackle, emphasizing his potential as a young player.
Terron Armstead offers to work with Campbell on technique issues during the offseason to improve his performance.

title: Video: Mike Vrabel shares message to distraught Patriots after Super Bowl loss
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Mike Vrabel encouraged the Patriots to look forward after their Super Bowl LX loss to the Seattle Seahawks.
The Patriots' season under Vrabel saw a significant turnaround with 14 wins and an AFC East title.
Vrabel expressed optimism about building on the successful 2025 season and strengthening the young roster.

title: Patriots reportedly make changes to coaching staff, move Williams to ‘high-ranking’ role
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The New England Patriots have promoted Terrell Williams to a high-ranking position on Mike Vrabel's staff.
Zak Kuhr is favored to succeed Terrell Williams as the Patriots' defensive coordinator for the 2026 season.
Terrell Williams, now cancer-free, traveled with the Patriots for Super Bowl LX, signaling a possible return to work.

title: Pittsfield man, 69, killed in hit-and-run crash that dragged him ‘lengthy distance,’ DA says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: William Colbert, 69, was killed in a hit-and-run in Pittsfield after being dragged by a car late Tuesday night.
The incident occurred near Linden Street and Francis Avenue; the vehicle fled the scene and police are searching for the driver.
The Berkshire District Attorney's Office urges anyone with information or surveillance footage to contact Pittsfield police.

title: ‘This is only the beginning’: Ann Michael Maye shares encouraging message after Patriots Super Bowl loss
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: The New England Patriots lost Super Bowl LX to the Seattle Seahawks, 29-13, after a challenging game.
Ann Michael Maye, wife of quarterback Drake Maye, shared an encouraging Instagram post about the team's season.
Drake Maye set a Super Bowl record for most passing yards in a quarter despite a shoulder injury.
